de.nenick.espressomacchiato.elements

Class EspAdapterView

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nenick.espressomacchiato.elements.EspView
      • de.nenick.espressomacchiato.elements.EspAdapterView
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EspListView

    public class EspAdapterView
extends EspView

    Base for actions and assertions for a AdapterView.

    Recommend is to use more specific elements like EspListView. For actions and assertions with AdapterView items see EspAdapterViewItem

    Since:
    Espresso Macchiato 0.3

        Returns:
        New element instance for action and assertions.
        Since:

      • assertItemCountIs

        public void assertItemCountIs(int expected)

        Check that the views adapter contains the expected count of items.

        This counts the items existing in adapter and not the visible items. Header and footer are count as list items.

        Parameters:
        expected - Zero for no items or a positive number.
        Since:
        Espresso Macchiato 0.3

      • itemByIndex

        public EspAdapterViewItem itemByIndex(int index)

        Access item by index known by the adapter.

        Parameters:
        index - Item index in adapter.
        Returns:
        New element instance for action and assertions.
        Since:
        Espresso Macchiato 0.5

      • itemByVisibleIndex

        public EspAdapterViewItem itemByVisibleIndex(int index)

        Access item by his visible index.

        Parameters:
        index - That is the index which a human can see.
        Returns:
        New element instance for action and assertions.
        Since:
        Espresso Macchiato 0.5
